Articles.Content:
How To Report Bugs

This is a detailed guide on how you should report bugs on this subforum. Please make sure to go over every step before submitting a report. you can find a blank bug report template at the bottom of this page.

The basic rules:

  • One bug per bug report
  • Avoid Duplicates (bugs that have already been reported)
  • Include ALL necessary files (save/craft files, logs, images/videos...)
  • Do not report feedback or suggestions


 

Step 1. Is This A Bug?

A bug is any form of unexpected behavior that occurs while playing the game. This can range from small typos in mission descriptions to mission-ending problems with say, docking ports. Bugs come in all shapes and sizes, but they all have one thing in common; 
The game is not doing what it's intended to do, and it's (usually) negatively affecting gameplay.

If your issue does not meet this criterium, please ask yourself if it might be better suited as feedback instead. Bug reports that are really feedback usually don't make it through our quality check.
Feedback and Suggestions can be posted in the appropriate channel here.

Some examples:

  • "I want to be able to see upcoming transfer windows!"
    => This is a Suggestion
  • "The VAB should let in more ambient light, it feels too moody in there"
    => This is Feedback
  • "My vessel falls through the surface on Vall..."
    => This is a Bug!
  • "My DeltaV readout in the VAB is completely wrong!"
    => This is a Bug!


 

Step 2. Has This Been Reported Before?

To keep the bug reports subforum clear of clutter and avoid spreading upvotes over multiple reports, we urge you to please make sure the bug you are reporting hasn't been previously reported. Don't forget to check the KSP2 Bug Reports Archive too; all bugs below a certain upvote treshold and/or age are moved into the Archives each time the game receives an update, and we rely on you to identify what bugs are still in the game. You can quickly let us a know a bug is still happening by submitting a new bug report that links to the one in the archive, or by tagging us under it in a comment (@Bug Hunter). Thanks!

Additional information on a bug can still be helpful, so if you run into a previously reported bug and would like to report it anyway; make sure to include a link to the existing report in your new report. This makes it easier for the Bug Hunter team to merge your report into that one, ensuring reports about a given bug stay centralized in one thread. For this reason, we also ask you to 
Please limit yourself to ONE bug per report.

How to search the forum for existing bug reports: (important!)

Spoiler
  1. Go to the 'KSP2 Bug Reports' page 
  2. In the 'Search' bar on the top right, type a keyword related to your bug. Make sure that the Selection on the search bar is set to 'These Forums'. Also ensure that all bug categories are enabled in the Categories window. Press the hourglass icon to search. (see example below)
    Spoiler

  3. You should now see a list of all mentions of your keyword on the bug reports subforum. There are a few things you can do to filter out research or broaden your search range:

    3.1. [in content titles only] turn this on to only see mentions of your keyword in bug report titles.

    3.2. [Adding Keywords] due to limitations of the forum, only mentions of the exact keyword will be shown. For words that have multiple variations (e.g. Parachute, Parachutes & Chutes), you might need to add those to your keyword string to get more results. To do this, simply add them to the search bar separated by a Space and press 'Search Again'. 

    3.3. [AND/OR] If you have multiple keywords in your search, you can select if you want to search for reports that include all keywords (AND) or reports that include any of your keywords (OR). 

    3.4. [Phrases] if you want to search for a phrase (e.g. "Time Warp"), put it in between quotation marks or select the 'Phrase' option in the filter options. 

    3.5. [Refresh Results] When you have finished setting your search parameters, press 'Search Again'. If no results appear, double check your search parameters or try using different keywords.

    If you're unsure, use this preset or see below for an example of how to use the search filters yourself:
    Spoiler

  4. Searching the Bug Report Archive:
    If you can't find any results, the report you are looking for may be archived. To search the archive, go to the 'Bug Reports Archive' page and repeat the above steps (preset here)
     
  5. If you still can't find an existing report; congrats, you've just discovered a unique bug! 
    If you did find an existing report and still want to make your own report, please include a link to the existing report in your report.


 

Step 3. Gathering Information

Before submitting a bug report, try to collect as much information about the bug as possible.
Try to describe the issue as well as you can. Be concise, but also include details: If you ran into an issue with a rocket, how did you build that rocket? If your trajectory looks weird around a certain planet, how did you get there? what launch vehicle did you use?

Ask yourself these questions:

  • What is happening? [REQUIRED]
  • What did you expect to happen?
  • Can this be reproduced? If yes, how?
  • How severe is this bug? 

Other information for your report:

  • Your Systems Specifications: CPU, GPU, RAM and OS [REQUIRED]
  • Images and Videos
  • Craft and Save files [in .json format]
  • Game logs
  • Player logs
  • [For Localization bugs only] Localization string

 

Not every bug report needs to have all this info. Sometimes a single line describing the issue is enough ("Hey, there's a typo in this part description..."), but in general try to include as many of these items as possible. The more complex the bug, the more info should be in the report. Save files, Craft files, Videos/Images, Reproduction Steps and Game Logs help the Bug Hunter team and QA to understand, reproduce and test your bug. Your efforts to collect these are greatly appreciated!


How to Find Save/Craft Files, Game Logs and System Specs:

Spoiler

Finding Game Files For Your Report:

Craft files can be found here: 

%userdata%\AppData\LocalLow\Intercept Games\Kerbal Space Program 2\Saves\SinglePlayer\%campaignname%\Workspaces\craftname.json


Save files can be found here: 

%userdata%\AppData\LocalLow\Intercept Games\Kerbal Space Program 2\Saves\SinglePlayer\%campaignname%\savename.json


Game logs can be found here: 

C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program 2\Ksp2.log


Player logs can be found here: 

%userdata%\AppData\LocalLow\Intercept Games\Kerbal Space Program 2\Player.Log


Localization strings can be found by turning on 'Show Localization' in the Cheat Menu (Alt-F8) > General  (only needed for localization bugs)

 

Finding Your System Specs:

STEAM

If you are running via Steam: Click “Help” in the upper left corner of the Steam window. From the menu, select "System Information". Take note of your CPU Brand, Video Card, RAM size and Operating System. You will need those for your report.

 

MANUAL

If you're not playing through Steam or would like more information, you can find your system specs this way:
 

In Windows – hit the Winkey (⊞ Win) to bring up the start menu and type in:  dxdiag

This will bring up the DirectX Diagnostic Tool. The first tab (System) will show your system model, processor, and memory, which you will need for your report. 

If you feel it might be beneficial to include additional system information in your report, click the “Save All Information” button at the bottom, and it’ll put everything into a text file. Nothing in that file should be harmful to send, but if you don’t want to share everything else on there, just do a screenshot of the important areas (the snipping tool works great for this):

The other tabs will give you information about your displays and video cards (which is typically more important if you are having performance issues). If you have multiple monitors or a laptop connecting to a monitor – then you might have to click on the last display tab to see the correct video card information.  Again, if you don’t want to share all your info – just get a screenshot of the important stuff:

A Note On System Specs: 
If you are below the minimum required specs for the game, you can still report bugs. Please mention this in your report however, and be aware that depending on the nature of your report your issue may not be a priority for the QA team.



Step 4. Formatting And Submitting Your Report

Once you have all the information you think you'll need, it's time to make a report. This paragraph will deal with what needs to be in that report, and how to format it properly. You'll also find an empty report template at the bottom of this paragraph. You do not have to be logged in to submit a bug report, but please note that submitting a report anonymously makes it impossible for the Bug Hunter team to contact you if they need more information about your report! Also keep in mind that Bug Hunters may change certain aspects of your report (such as title or category) or add context if deemed necessary.

To begin writing your report, go to

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forms/2-ksp2br/

This will take you to the Bug Reports Form. It should look like this:

Spoiler



 

  1. Category
    First, you will need to choose a fitting category for your bug. If you are unsure what category best describes your bug, take a look in the spoiler below to see the various categories and which bugs generally fall under them. Don't worry about getting it wrong: the Bug Hunter team will change the category to whichever one fits best during the review process (if needed).
    Spoiler
    • Crash: For all bugs that cause the game to freeze, crash to desktop or otherwise completely stop working.
      Example: "Multiport Docking results in Crash to Desktop"
       
    • Construction: For all bugs involving problems that occur while or stem from building crafts in the VAB. Note: this category should NOT be used for all VAB bugs, only for those directly involving construction!
      Example: "When Trying To Close A Fairing, It Will Disappear Instead"
       
    • Environmental and Terrain: For all bugs that involve visual and gameplay issues with celestial objects and their environment, such as odd terrain features/textures, weird looking atmospheres, rendering/artefacting issues, problems with the skybox and more.
      Example: "Ridge glitch in the terrain texture on The Mun"
       
    • Flight: General category for any misbehavior of the game you experience while you're out exploring, that is not directly related to a certain part or vessel. Areas that are covered under this category include, but are not limited to: maneuver plans, staging, SAS/RCS behavior issues, timewarp, CommNet, (reentry) heating, atmospheric drag, action groups, kraken attacks and more.
      Example: "Vessels Dont Always Get Destroyed When Hitting Kerbols Surface"
       
    • FX and Audio: For all bugs involving music, audio and VFX (examples of VFX: explosions, engine plumes, reentry effects, water splashes...)
      Example: "Engine surface VFX does not disappear when engine is turned off"
       
    • Localization and Text: For all spelling mistakes, incorrect text, translation errors and localization issues.
      Example: "Spelling Mistake In PB-NUK Part Description"
       
    • Map and Tracking: For all bugs that only occur within Map view and/or the Tracking station. Can also include UI bugs if they're specific to map view or the tracking station, this is a bit of a gray area.
      Example: "No Trajectory Lines in Map View"
       
    • Missions: For all Mission-related bugs, such as mission completing prematurely and missions not completing.
      Example: "Secondary Mission 'Going Green' Conditions Are Falsely Met"
       
    • Parts and Vessels: For all bugs that are specific to a certain part, configuration of parts or vessel. This category can have a bit of overlap with Flight, but if a specific part has a specific issue, this is the best category to report it under. Note: Kerbals also count as vessels!
      Example: "J-33 Puts Itself In Reverse When Out Of Air"
       
    • Performance: For all performance issues, including lag spikes, greatly decreased fps, temporary freezes etc.
      Example: "Performance drops when viewing inside fairings"
       
    • Saving and Loading: For all bugs that interfere with saving/loading, or are (indirectly) caused by saving the game or loading a savefile (such as a vessel exploding after loading a quicksave). Note: Reverting to launch/VAB, switching scenes or saving/loading craft files in the VAB also fall under this category.
      Example: "Loading a Quicksave Resets The Current Flags Picture to Default"
       
    • Settings: For all bugs involving the Settings menu not working as intended.
      Example: "Unable to bind E to anything"
       
    • Tutorials: For all bugs and issues with(in) the tutorials. 
      Example: "Picture-in-picture images and videos not shown during tutorials"
       
    • UI/UX: For all bugs and problems with the User Interface and User Experience. This includes issues with UI elements and menus, but also more general issues affecting the player experience. Note: Camera bugs fall under this category too.
      Example: "Science Inventory UI element appears offscreen"
       
    • Other: For issues that don't fit any of the above categories.
      Example: "PNG Files Aren't Deleted When Deleting Craft Files When In The Vab"

     

  2. Title
    Next, choose a title for your report. This should be a short sentence that accurately describes the bug. Ideally, your title should follow the Problem-Action-Location Format:
    - Problem: The bug itself, e.g. "Vessel Explodes"
    - Action: The action you were doing when the bug occurred (if applicable), e.g. "After Loading Quicksave"
    - Location: The situation the bug occurs in, e.g. "In Low Orbit Around Kerbin"

    Example of a Good Title:
    "Vessel Control Is Not Transferred When Clicking 'Control' In The Tracking Station"     => Perfect!

    Examples of a Bad Title:
    "Tracking Station Bug"     => Not descriptive enough
    "This stupid bug wont let me control my rocket after i click 'control' a thousand times in the tracking station!"    => Too long, too informal

     
  3. Description
    This is the 'body' of your report. It should contain a concise description of the bug, steps to reproduce it, videos and images, and additional information if needed. To keep all reports as uniform as possible, we ask you to follow the following format (a blank template can be found at the bottom of this guide):

    Severity: Choose how severe you think this bug is. Choose between (None/Low/Medium/High).
    Frequency: Choose how often this bug occurs. Choose between (Once/Rare/Inconsistent/Always).
    How do i rate Severity and Frequency?
    Spoiler

    Severity
    This field is for your opinion of how severe the bug is. Please keep in mind that the QA Team may assign your bug a different severity rating internally.

    1. High: This is a gamebreaking bug that has a serious impact on core gameplay mechanics (example: issues with key gameplay features)
    2. Medium: This bug has an impact on gameplay, but is not gamebreaking (example: parts not working as intended)
    3. Low: This is a minor bug with minimal impact on gameplay (example: UI issues)
    4. None: This bug has no impact on gameplay (example: typo's, small visual errors...)


    Frequency
    The best way to rate the frequency of a bug is to try to reproduce it a few times ingame. Try to reproduce the bug in a new campaign if you can; reproducing a bug from scratch gives a better idea about its frequency than working from a specific save file.

    1. Always: You can reproduce this bug 100% of the time
    2. Inconsistent: This bug doesn't always happen, but you can reproduce it with a few tries or a specific save file
    3. Rare: This bug doesn't occur often and is hard to reproduce
    4. Once: This bug only happened a single time and you weren't able to reproduce it



    Issue:
    Describe what's happening, what you expected to happen, what you were doing when it happened, etc. If the bug happened to a specific craft, tell us how you built that craft. If it happened around a specific celestial body, tell us how you got there. The more information here the better, be as specific as you can! 

    Important Note: do NOT rely on the title to explain the bug! Your report may get merged into an existing report thread, which will cause the title to be lost. 

    Steps To Reproduce:
    If your bug is reproducible, list the (simplest) steps to reproduce it here. Saying "Load this quicksave" is good; saying how you got to when that quicksave was made is better! (tip: use the "Numbered List" tool in the format header) 

    Videos/Images: (optional)
    See '4. Attachments'

    Additional Information: (optional)
    if you have any additional info you'd like to share with the Bug Hunter/QA team, this is the place to do it.

    Example of a good Bug Report Description:
    Spoiler


     
  4. Attachments
    Next up, you'll add Videos, Images, Craft/Save Files, (Player) Logs and other media to your report.
    There are multiple options to add media and files. The most conventional method is to use the built-in upload feature (see spoiler below). Any file you upload will automatically appear at the bottom of your report after submitting. Using this feature, you can upload one file to each category. If you want to include multiple screenshots, videos, or files, you can either put them into a single ZIP file or use an alternative method for adding media (see further).
    Spoiler

    Example:



    Guidelines and alternatives for adding images and videos:      Please Read!
    Spoiler

    A. Images
    You can also use Imgur to directly upload images into the report description (see the spoiler below). Please do not use Discord links for images and videos; these are temporary and will dissapear after some time, resulting in media going missing from the report down the line.
     If you don't want your images and videos to take up too much space, you can place them inside a spoiler (eye icon on the format bar).

    Spoiler

    Using Imgur for Images:
    To add images using Imgur go to imgur.com. click 'New Post' and upload/paste your screenshot. Next, from the menu, select 'get share links' and copy the 'BBCode (Forums)' entry. Back on the forum, click the 'Other Media' button, select 'Insert Image from URL', paste the link, remove the identifiers and click 'Insert into post'. See below for a video example:


    B. Videos
    You can also upload videos to YouTube and paste a link to the them into the report (make sure they are either Public or Unlisted). The forums will automatically embed the video into the report. Please keep a few things in mind when submitting videos:

    - When uploading videos through the forum, only use the mp4 format. The forum does not support other video formats.
    - When uploading videos through the forum, Make sure your video file is an appropriate size.  The team needs to be able to download videos to view and embed them. (using Handbrake is a great way to compress large video files without sacrificing quality)
    - If you are uploading a long video, please add a timestamp to when the bug occurs in your report. 



     
  5. Computer Specifications
    This is where your system information goes. You will need your CPU, GPU, RAM and Operating System. These will automatically be formatted into your report after submitting. If you think your report might benefit from additional information about your system, feel free to add a screenshot of your extended specs to the report.
    Spoiler

    Example:


     
  6. Other
    You're almost finished writing your report! All that's left to do is select the game version you encountered this bug in, to let us know if you had any mods installed, and if the bug was reproducible without them. Do not report bugs that occured on modded installs, unless you are absolutely certain they are reproducible on unmodded installs. If you do wish to report a bug that is reproducible on an unmodded install, please only use save files made in the unmodded install; the Bug Hunter and QA teams can't open modded save files.
    Spoiler

    Example:




    Once your bug report is ready, read and acknowledge the statement on information and content posted on the forum, and press 'Send'. Your report will appear on the bug reports subforum as soon as a member of the Bug Hunter team approves it. Please be aware that this may take some time. If we deem your report needs additional information, we may reach out to you via DM.

    Happy Bug Reporting, Kerbonauts!

 

BUG REPORT TEMPLATE:  (please do NOT copy paste with formatting)

Spoiler

Severity: None/Low/Medium/High
Frequency: Once/Rare/Inconsistent/Always

Issue:

 

Steps to Reproduce:

  1.  

Images:

Spoiler

 

Video Evidence:

Spoiler

 

Additional Information:
 


Public Postings

If you share personal information, post an image or video, or provide other content in public forums such as on a message board, chat room, comment field, or profile page, other people can view, collect, and use that information. If your user name or ID contains your name, your name will be publicly available on leaderboards and elsewhere as described in this Privacy Policy. Users of such public forums may be able to identify you, use the information to send you messages, or copy any of the images, video, or content you have shared. There is no expectation of privacy or confidentiality on any of these public forums. Please do not share your personal information in public forums or in your user name or ID. You are responsible for any information or content you publicly post using our Services. 

Thanks! 

-The Bug Hunter team
